programme.title: ABC Agathy Christie
programme.desc: Rok 1933. Emerytowany belgijski detektyw Herkules Poirot (John Malkovich) stara się wytropić wyrafinowanego seryjnego zabójcę, który wysyła tajemnicze listy podpisane "ABC". Śledczy musi je rozszyfrować, aby odkryć tożsamość niebezpiecznego przestępcy. Wspiera go inspektor Crome (Rubert Grint). Trzymająca w napięciu adaptacja prozy mistrzyni gatunku - Agathy Christie - z nominowanym w karierze dwukrotnie do Oscara ("Miejsca w sercu", "Na linii ognia") Johnem Malkovichem.

Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thelmalee"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy the family dinners, and the religion (I'm not Catholic)","reviewBody":"My sister and I watch and discuss this series every Friday. We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner. 

(St. Vincent's Hospital is still open in this drama - ah, if only it were so.)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-09-24","keywords":"new york police department,family relationships,brother brother relationship,father daughter relationship,family of cops","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005531/","name":"Donnie Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261678/","name":"Will Estes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315236/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121331/","name":"Mitchell Burgess"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053841/","name":"Robin Green"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Bloods: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4119967769","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer for Blue Bloods"}}</script><metacontent="

Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"thelmalee","dateCreated":"2013-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy the family dinners, and the religion (I'm not Catholic)","reviewBody":"My sister and I watch and discuss this series every Friday. We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner. 

(St. Vincent's Hospital is still open in this drama - ah, if only it were so.)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-09-24","keywords":"new york police department,family relationships,brother brother relationship,father daughter relationship,family of cops","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005531/","name":"Donnie Wahlberg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261678/","name":"Will Estes"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315236/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121331/","name":"Mitchell Burgess","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053841/","name":"Robin Green"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Bloods: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4119967769","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer for Blue Bloods"</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 10257404, Title: Death at the Mansion: Rebecca Zahau, --- Description: Death at the Mansion: Rebecca Zahau: With Jason Benjamin, Frederick Keeve, Molly Loch, Maki Saruwatari. Experts examine the case of a woman, who was found dead, hanging naked, bound and gagged in the courtyard of her billionaire boyfriend's mansion just two days after his son suffered a fatal accident while she watched him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10257404/","name":"Death at the Mansion: Rebecca Zahau","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTI2ZTU2N2QtNDY0Ni00ZTM0LWFiZjMtYTJmNjIzMjNiOTU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTEwMTY1OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Experts examine the case of a woman, who was found dead, hanging naked, bound and gagged in the courtyard of her billionaire boyfriend's mansion just two days after his son suffered a fatal accident while she watched him.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10257404/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mrneilfrancis","dateCreated":"2020-01-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Clown Investigators.","reviewBody":"Don't waste four hours of your time. This could have been just one episode. The two rocky clown investigators seem to spend ages working out would she have tied her hands behind her back if it was suicide. That small part got stretched out for so long I lost the will to live. I did manage to watch it till the end but I can honestly say my 10-year-old would have been a better investigative supporter and probably director of this disjointed mess.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"genre":["Documentary","Crime"],"datePublished":"2019-06-01","keywords":"tv mini series","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2398956/","name":"Jason Benjamin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0444858/","name":"Frederick Keeve","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6855696/","name":"Molly Loch"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0632860/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DEATH AT THE MANSION: REBECCA ZAHAU: Final Theories","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi741325849","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDEzNWIyOGUtNzhhNy00NDIzLWI0ODEtZGFkMTYzZTcwYzM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDEzNWIyOGUtNzhhNy00NDIzLWI0ODEtZGFkMTYzZTcwYzM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"DEATH AT THE MANSION: REBECCA ZAHAU: Final Theories"</script><metacontent="

We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner.

programme.title: Szczescie swiata
Szczęście świata
programme.desc:
Szczescie swiata: Directed by Michal Rosa. With Karolina Gruszka, Mateusz Lickindorf, Grzegorz Palkowski, Dariusz Chojnacki. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent--but unusual--Polish film","reviewBody":"The Polish film Szczescie swiata (2016) was shown in the U.S. with the title The Happiness of the World. It was written and directed by Michal Rosa.

The movie is set in 1939 in an apartment house in Silesia--an area of Poland close to the German border. The apartment house itself is unusual. It's clearly not far from a city, but it sits in lonely isolation in a field. It's a very upscale place, and most of the people who live in it are middle or upper class. It's not what we in the U.S. would call a tenement, with poor people making ends meet. It's very elegant.

The plot centers around a journalist from a large city who is sent to the area to track down an elusive bestselling author. This search is more or less just a way to begin the story. When the reporter arrives, his first meeting is with the beautiful Róza, portrayed by Karolina Gruszka. 

Róza has many charms, which she openly displays to the reporter, as well as to any other man who joins her. In turn, director Rosa openly displays Gruszka's charms to his audience. We can all see why she's called "The Happiness of the World."

The movie plot is actually a series of vignettes. Each inhabitant of the apartment building has her or his own story. To a certain extent, the stories intersect, because all of the characters live in the same place. The pivotal figure in all of this is Róza. Karolina Gruszka isn't just another pretty face. She's an extraordinary actor, who is well known in Poland. The movie will rise or fall depending on Gruszka's presence on the screen. She's great, and the film rises accordingly.

We watched this movie in Rochester's excellent Little Theatre. It will work well on the small screen. The film was shown at the outstanding 2017 Rochester Polish Film Festival. After the film, director Rosa was in attendance for a Q&A session. (He doesn't speak English, but the interpreter who worked with him was superb.) My compliments to the PFF for bringing the director to Rochester.

For me, the most striking aspect of the Q&A was Mr. Rosa's discussion of magical realism. I believe that everyone in the audience noted magical realism in the movie. Director Rosa says that it isn't magical realism--it's just realism. I'm not sure if he was joking with us when he said that, or whether he actually believes that the type of events he shows us aren't magical at all. You'll have to watch the movie to see what you think about this realism.

P.S. The Happiness of the World has a dismal IMDb rating of 6.3. It's a much, much better movie than that. Again, you'll have to watch the movie and then decide for yourself.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":124,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-12-23","keywords":"silesia,bathtub,femme fatale","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344734/","name":"Karolina Gruszka"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8475166/","name":"Mateusz Lickindorf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2707614/","name":"Grzegorz Palkowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577510/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 6104188, Title: Szczescie swiata, --- Description: Szczescie swiata: Directed by Michal Rosa. With Karolina Gruszka, Mateusz Lickindorf, Grzegorz Palkowski, Dariusz Chojnacki. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125","dateCreated":"2017-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent--but unusual--Polish film","reviewBody":"The Polish film Szczescie swiata (2016) was shown in the U.S. with the title The Happiness of the World. It was written and directed by Michal Rosa.

The movie is set in 1939 in an apartment house in Silesia--an area of Poland close to the German border. The apartment house itself is unusual. It's clearly not far from a city, but it sits in lonely isolation in a field. It's a very upscale place, and most of the people who live in it are middle or upper class. It's not what we in the U.S. would call a tenement, with poor people making ends meet. It's very elegant.

The plot centers around a journalist from a large city who is sent to the area to track down an elusive bestselling author. This search is more or less just a way to begin the story. When the reporter arrives, his first meeting is with the beautiful Róza, portrayed by Karolina Gruszka. 

Róza has many charms, which she openly displays to the reporter, as well as to any other man who joins her. In turn, director Rosa openly displays Gruszka's charms to his audience. We can all see why she's called "The Happiness of the World."

The movie plot is actually a series of vignettes. Each inhabitant of the apartment building has her or his own story. To a certain extent, the stories intersect, because all of the characters live in the same place. The pivotal figure in all of this is Róza. Karolina Gruszka isn't just another pretty face. She's an extraordinary actor, who is well known in Poland. The movie will rise or fall depending on Gruszka's presence on the screen. She's great, and the film rises accordingly.

We watched this movie in Rochester's excellent Little Theatre. It will work well on the small screen. The film was shown at the outstanding 2017 Rochester Polish Film Festival. After the film, director Rosa was in attendance for a Q&A session. (He doesn't speak English, but the interpreter who worked with him was superb.) My compliments to the PFF for bringing the director to Rochester.

For me, the most striking aspect of the Q&A was Mr. Rosa's discussion of magical realism. I believe that everyone in the audience noted magical realism in the movie. Director Rosa says that it isn't magical realism--it's just realism. I'm not sure if he was joking with us when he said that, or whether he actually believes that the type of events he shows us aren't magical at all. You'll have to watch the movie to see what you think about this realism.

P.S. The Happiness of the World has a dismal IMDb rating of 6.3. It's a much, much better movie than that. Again, you'll have to watch the movie and then decide for yourself.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":124,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-12-23","keywords":"silesia,bathtub,femme fatale","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344734/","name":"Karolina Gruszka","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8475166/","name":"Mateusz Lickindorf","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2707614/","name":"Grzegorz Palkowski"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577510/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Incident at Loch Ness
Incydent w Loch Ness
Incident at Loch Ness
programme.desc:
Incident at Loch Ness: Directed by Zak Penn. With Werner Herzog, Kitana Baker, Gabriel Beristain, Russell Williams II. A documentary exploring the myth of the Loch Ness monster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0374639/","name":"Incident at Loch Ness","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE2OTUwMTYzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzA4MDcyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary exploring the myth of the Loch Ness monster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0374639/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Cheetah-6"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Clever, Amusing, Con Job That Leaves You Wondering","reviewBody":"Like a big budget Blair Witch Project this is a clever and amusing con job that shows the manipulative power of the documentary but as the film becomes more and more preposterous and the con becomes more obvious the joke goes a bit flat.

Lately the documentary genre has been messed with royally with blending opinion and personal agenda with fact mainly for entertainment value ala Michael Moore and Morgan Spurlock's Super Size Me, but this one side steps in yet another direction and seems to me to be satirizing the whole mocumentary process which would make it a joke within a joke and a true original. It's not entirely clear if this is the intent of the film, which only adds to the enigma. I like to think it is.

It is refreshing to see a legend like Herzog willing to poke fun at his own obsessive reputation and it's his charismatic presence that carries the film.

I don't know when the mocumentary first showed up in film but one of the first I recall that's well worth checking out if you like this sort of thing is Woody Allen's great from 1983: Zelig.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4091,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2004-09-17","keywords":"inverness scotland,fake cryptozoologist,wonderland avenue los angeles,year 2003,boat engine","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001348/","name":"Werner Herzog"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1128564/","name":"Kitana Baker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075244/","name":"Gabriel Beristain"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672015/","name":"Zak Penn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0156805/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672015/","name":"Zak Penn"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

Lately the documentary genre has been messed with royally with blending opinion and personal agenda with fact mainly for entertainment value ala Michael Moore and Morgan Spurlock's Super Size Me, but this one side steps in yet another direction and seems to me to be satirizing the whole mocumentary process which would make it a joke within a joke and a true original. While serving a five-year sentence for a violent crime, a 12-year-old boy sues his parents for neglect." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8267604/","name":"Capharnaüm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmExNzU2ZWMtYzUwYi00YmM2LTkxZTQtNmVhNjY0NTMyMWI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"While serving a five-year sentence for a violent crime, a 12-year-old boy sues his parents for neglect.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8267604/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tedicaprio"},"dateCreated":"2019-07-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Two great boys!","reviewBody":"OMG. On her wild quest for love, 9-year-old Benni's untamed energy drives everyone around her to despair." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8535968/","name":"Systemsprenger","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDVmYWM4ZDItODliOC00NDVkLThmYmItNTU4N2NlYTY4NTIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjIxMDAyNzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"On her wild quest for love, 9-year-old Benni's untamed energy drives everyone around her to despair.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8535968/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mandy-1"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stunning Portrayal of an Out of Control Child","reviewBody":"I saw this at the Palm Springs Film Festival. It was so real I had to remind myself it was a theatrical film, not a documentary, when it was over. It's raw and moving, flawlessly directed, edited and above all acted. Not easy to view but so well worth it. It's been a week and I still think about it. I imagine it will be in indy theaters before long. If you get a chance and like truly unique films, go see it!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11789,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-09-19","keywords":"child thief,taking a shower,hitchhiking,urinating on the floor,wet pants","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1689763609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYxMzljNjQtYWZiYS00ODc2LWExOGYtMWRhNjVlZjg2MjY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYxMzljNjQtYWZiYS00ODc2LWExOGYtMWRhNjVlZjg2MjY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8023748/","name":"Helena Zengel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3477129/","name":"Albrecht Schuch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0772609/","name":"Gabriela Maria Schmeide"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3519173/","name":"Nora Fingscheidt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0258575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0284355/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0620012/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3519173/","name":"Nora Fingscheidt"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: II koncert na wiolonczelę i orkiestrę
programme.desc: Pasją okulisty Macieja Gasika jest muzyka. W trakcie jednego z koncertów mężczyzna doznaje udaru mózgu. Staje się więźniem własnego ciała. Postanawia się nie poddawać i zawalczyć o swoją godność oraz wolność. Film na podstawie prawdziwej historii. Scenariusz stworzono do koncertu wiolonczelowego Pawła Mykietyna.

Wołyń
programme.desc:
Wolyn: Directed by Wojciech Smarzowski. With Michalina Labacz, Arkadiusz Jakubik, Wasyl Wasylik, Adrian Zaremba. Despite being in love with a Ukrainian boy from the same village, Polish girl named Zosia is forced into marrying a wealthy widower. Soon World War II begins and ethnic tensions arise. Amidst the war chaos Zosia tries to survive." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6068960/","name":"Wolyn","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODM4YTk3NzgtMmUxNy00NThlLWE3YzctOWJhNmQ4OTBiZTkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzY4MDEwMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Despite being in love with a Ukrainian boy from the same village, Polish girl named Zosia is forced into marrying a wealthy widower. Soon World War II begins and ethnic tensions arise. Amidst the war chaos Zosia tries to survive.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6068960/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ktrelski"},"dateCreated":"2016-11-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Prepare yourself for sleepless night","reviewBody":"When I went to see this movie I thought I know everything about the events this picture is based on. I have heard that the movie will show them without any censorship. However, I was not prepared for the real horror of those events. The movie is graphic, but it does not go overboard. It does, however touch your soul. If you ever asked yourself what the real terror looks like, this is it. What makes it tough is that the terror is brought to you by the people you know well, your next door neighbors, your spouse or even your brother.

Do not expect anybody laughing or even talking after the movie is over. 

It is a great movie. Don't miss it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5393,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"2016-10-07","keywords":"genocide,year 1943,world war two,massacre,nudity","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8443804/","name":"Michalina Labacz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1458971/","name":"Arkadiusz Jakubik"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8443805/","name":"Wasyl Wasylik"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500530/","name":"Wojciech Smarzowski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0692063/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0692062/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500530/","name":"Wojciech Smarzowski"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Raising Arizona
Arizona Junior
Raising Arizona
programme.desc: Raising Arizona: Directed by Joel Coen, Ethan Coen. With Nicolas Cage, Holly Hunter, Trey Wilson, John Goodman. When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0093822/","name":"Raising Arizona","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUwZTEwZTYtZmQ0OS00NmM1LWE2ZTQtNjZiYmE4ZmUxMjk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bat-5"},"dateCreated":"1998-10-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"pure lunacy","reviewBody":"Pure lunacy is what Raising Arizona is. It's got everything you could ask for in a film; kidnapping, jailbreaks, Hell's Angels, explosions and guns, guns guns. Nic Cage is great in the role of a very befuddled conveniance store robber who falls in love with Holly Hunter's Ed. Throw in John Goodman and William Forsythe as a couple of car stealing, bank robbing brothers and you got yourself scenes that will make you giggle when you think back about them. The entire state of Arizona seems trigger happy in the Coen's eyes. Clerks, cops, and crooks pull out firearms and let loose like the finale of the 1812 Overture. Plus, where else can you hear really good yodeling?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":132052,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1987-04-17","keywords":"arizona desert,state name in title,arizona,phoenix arizona,diaper","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"'Buster Scruggs': The Coen Bros.' Misunderstood, Misanthropic Masterwork","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2967845401","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNjc0MmMtYTk0MC00NTNjLWJlMzYtN2U2Njg5MjM2MjZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNjc0MmMtYTk0MC00NTNjLWJlMzYtN2U2Njg5MjM2MjZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"We're rootin' and tootin' about the Coen Brothers' new movie, but wasn't this supposed to be their first TV mini-series? programme.title: Kiler
Kiler
programme.desc: Kiler: Directed by Juliusz Machulski. With Cezary Pazura, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Jerzy Stuhr, Janusz Rewinski. An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0127626/","name":"Kiler","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDRkNWMxYWEtODUwMC00ZDRjLWI0MmQtMjFjNTFiMDYwZDZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0127626/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cjpok"},"dateCreated":"1999-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lots of action with funny twists","reviewBody":"This could easily be called the Polish version of "Pulp Fiction" but thank God, it is not. It is captivating from the very get-go, keeping the viewing audience as hostage to the very end. Although unique in style and approach, it is universal and could appeal to any audience, anywhere in the world. Humorous and tastefully prepared.No wonder Hollywood already bought rights to the story. We may see it on this side of the pond. I hope without Bruce Willis or other Hollywood screen "heroes". programme.title: Ewolucja Jackiego Chana
programme.desc: Kulisy spektakularnej kariery Jackiego Chana. Tego znanego artystę można nazwać człowiekiem instytucją. Oprócz tego że jest cenionym aktorem, pracuje także jako kaskader, scenarzysta i reżyser, a także biznesmen. Jak nikt inny w branży filmowej potrafi widowiskowo łączyć azjatyckie kino sztuk walki z chaplinowskim humorem oraz hollywoodzkim rozmachem.

programme.title: The Daughter
Powrót
The Daughter
programme.desc: The Daughter: Directed by Simon Stone. With Geoffrey Rush, Nicholas Hope, Sam Neill, Ewen Leslie. The story follows a man who returns home to discover a long-buried family secret, and whose attempts to put things right threaten the lives of those he left home years before." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3922816/","name":"The Daughter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MzA0MTUyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTkyMjEyNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story follows a man who returns home to discover a long-buried family secret, and whose attempts to put things right threaten the lives of those he left home years before.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3922816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mmunier"},"dateCreated":"2016-03-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A wild and wounded duck witnesses human inter...actions","reviewBody":"Perhaps I was not in the mood for it, went to watch "the daughter" after a coin toss with the alternative to be "the lady in the van". After reading the account of a Canadian here I was wondering if we saw the same thing! Yet all that was said was very much what I saw (save some early parts when I closed my eyes out of boredom) Some may say it was only my loss and they may be right, however that's how I felt. The inspiration for this film I'm told is a Danish work "the wild duck". Well the duck did it for me. As for the rest, so much can be written about it, or simply it can just be an every day sad story about things going wrong when people stop caring for each others. Yet I was surprised to be quite moved at some of the acting despite the lack of interest I seemed to have for the story. I guess I may be on my own with this assessment if I go by most others comment. After reading the account of a Canadian here I was wondering if we saw the same thing! Yet all that was said was very much what I saw (save some early parts when I closed my eyes out of boredom) Some may say it was only my loss and they may be right, however that's how I felt. The inspiration for this film I'm told is a Danish work "the wild duck". Well the duck did it for me. As for the rest, so much can be written about it, or simply it can just be an every day sad story about things going wrong when people stop caring for each others. Yet I was surprised to be quite moved at some of the acting despite the lack of interest I seemed to have for the story. I guess I may be on my own with this assessment if I go by most others comment. programme.title: Ma saison préférée

programme.desc:
Ma saison préférée: Directed by André Téchiné. With Catherine Deneuve, Daniel Auteuil, Marthe Villalonga, Jean-Pierre Bouvier. Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, and will be depicted both Berthe's destiny and the strange relationship between Emilie and Antoine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107471/","name":"Ma saison préférée","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0NzE2MzA2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDc3NTkwMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, an","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107471/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"senortuffy"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"The curse of modernity.","reviewBody":"This is a film that centers around dysfunctional family life, however, it is not about incest as one viewer suggested.

 Catherine Deneuve plays Emilie, an emotionally detached middle-aged woman who feels like she losing her grip. She's a lawyer, as is her husband, Bruno, but there is no love left in their marriage and her two nearly grown up children are estranged from her.

A crisis sets off a chain of events in her life. Her mother, Berthe, is having fainting spells and the doctors feels she shouldn't be alone at her country home, so Emilie invites her to stay with her family. No one is happy with the arrangement. Bruno resents her presence, and both he and his daughter think everyone in Emilie's family is crazy.

Emilie's brother, Antoine, a fussy little brain surgeon played by Daniel Auteuil, is invited by Emilie for Christmas Eve dinner. He doesn't get along with her family and soon an argument breaks out when Berthe tries to get her children to sit still while she discusses her will. Antoine leaves with his mother, to take her back to her home, and Emilie leaves after a bitter argument with Bruno.

The film follows the developing relationship among this circle of people. Everyone is wrapped up with their own lives and extremely possessive. No one really knows how to reach out to another human being.

We learn that Berthe and her husband were simple country folk - she never learned how to read - who only wanted what was best for their children. Berthe tells them their father only wanted them to be "modern." But modernity has its price. 

Both the children are too busy with their own lives to take her in when she suffers another fainting spell, so she is placed in a rest home and begins to deteriorate. Antoine doesn't recognize that she's suffered a brain lesion because of a stroke - this is supposed to be his specialty, but he can't see what's right in front of him. Emilie's law practice centers around personal estates, but she has a hard time connecting with her own mother.

After the funeral, the whole family gets together at Emilie's old home and sits outside for a meal. They begin to talk and show more friendliness towards each other than in the past - Bruno even invites Antoine to sleep the night over. The title from the film comes from the last snippet of conversation when everyone confesses what their favorite season of the year is.

This is a fine film that explores adult relationships. It's rather candid and not as histrionic as, say "Ordinary People." The acting is well-done - Catherine Deneuve continues to age extraordinarily well - and the scenery of rural Southwest France is stunningly pastoral.

Because of its drab subject matter, this one might not appeal to everyone, but it's a very good movie and I recommend it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1998,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-05-14","keywords":"three word title,first person title,male objectification,male rear nudity,bare butt","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0897811/","name":"Marthe Villalonga"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022244/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094726/","name":"Pascal Bonitzer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

 Catherine Deneuve plays Emilie, an emotionally detached middle-aged woman who feels like she losing her grip. She's a lawyer, as is her husband, Bruno, but there is no love left in their marriage and her two nearly grown up children are estranged from her.

A crisis sets off a chain of events in her life. Her mother, Berthe, is having fainting spells and the doctors feels she shouldn't be alone at her country home, so Emilie invites her to stay with her family. No one is happy with the arrangement. Bruno resents her presence, and both he and his daughter think everyone in Emilie's family is crazy.

Emilie's brother, Antoine, a fussy little brain surgeon played by Daniel Auteuil, is invited by Emilie for Christmas Eve dinner. He doesn't get along with her family and soon an argument breaks out when Berthe tries to get her children to sit still while she discusses her will. Antoine leaves with his mother, to take her back to her home, and Emilie leaves after a bitter argument with Bruno.

The film follows the developing relationship among this circle of people. Everyone is wrapped up with their own lives and extremely possessive. No one really knows how to reach out to another human being.

We learn that Berthe and her husband were simple country folk - she never learned how to read - who only wanted what was best for their children. Berthe tells them their father only wanted them to be "modern." But modernity has its price. 

Both the children are too busy with their own lives to take her in when she suffers another fainting spell, so she is placed in a rest home and begins to deteriorate. Antoine doesn't recognize that she's suffered a brain lesion because of a stroke - this is supposed to be his specialty, but he can't see what's right in front of him. Emilie's law practice centers around personal estates, but she has a hard time connecting with her own mother.

After the funeral, the whole family gets together at Emilie's old home and sits outside for a meal. Revolves around a character named Jake Gray and his friends that have been playing a deadly game called "The Pathway", which eventually spirals out of control and threatens a worldwide epidemic of violence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406706/","name":"Devour","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAzMTcxMjA1OTReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDc0MDYwMDcx._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a character named Jake Gray and his friends that have been playing a deadly game called "The Pathway", which eventually spirals out of control and threatens a worldwide epidemic of violence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406706/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nirvanareaper"},"dateCreated":"2007-11-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting","reviewBody":"OK, here's what I think. I think it's a good storyline but it didn't transfer to screen very well. The only thing I really liked about this movie was Jensen Ackles. In my opinion he's too good of an actor to be in a movie like this. I mean not genre wise but it looks like it was made by an amateur. So, I did like the plot but I didn't like how it was played out. Also, it was cool to see Jensen act with his dad! Even Jensen pretty much said in an interview that it didn't come out like he was expecting it to. He said he kept thinking "What the hell is going on?" So, we're not alone. Raise your standards a bit Jen! They should have made it more like Supernatural haha","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4791,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2005-05-31","keywords":"teen slasher,slasher,daydreams,teen angst,teacher","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010075/","name":"Jensen Ackles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0815370/","name":"Shannyn Sossamon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000663/","name":"Dominique Swain"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0935210/","name":"David Winkler"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0137851/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0163248/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129644/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1604669/","name":"Adam Gross"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1603708/","name":"Seth Gross"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Land of the Dead: Directed by George A. Romero. With Simon Baker, John Leguizamo, Dennis Hopper, Asia Argento. The living dead have taken over the world, and the last humans live in a walled city to protect themselves as they come to grips with the situation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0418819/","name":"Land of the Dead","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzU1MDI1NDM1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzU5OTkyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The living dead have taken over the world, and the last humans live in a walled city to protect themselves as they come to grips with the situation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0418819/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lastliberal"},"dateCreated":"2007-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Certainly a blood fest","reviewBody":"Simon Baker leads in this film as a mercenary who wants to head up North. Maybe the undead do not like the cold. He find himself trapped between various warring factions, including a ruthless CEO (Dennis Hopper) who offers safety to the wealthy while allowing the unwashed masses to fend for themselves, a fellow mercenary (John Leguizamo) who will sacrifice anyone to advance his own agenda, and hordes of zombies who are starting to take steps up the evolutionary ladder. They actually used a gun in this film. First time I've seen a zombie do more than eat. They even went in the water. Apes don't do that! Lots of blood, but there was less action than I've seen and more talking.\n\nI love John Leguizamo, and that made it worth my time. Seeing Asia Argento (xXx) wasn't bad either.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":94382,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-08-24","keywords":"zombie apocalypse,post apocalypse,zombie film,zombie survival,survival horror","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Land of the Dead","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1419051289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODZhYWUxMDQtNWMzOC00ZjM2LWI2ZWEtNjliNzU5YjEwYThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODZhYWUxMDQtNWMzOC00ZjM2LWI2ZWEtNjliNzU5YjEwYThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000491/","name":"John Leguizamo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000782/","name":"Asia Argento"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048932/","name":"Simon Baker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001681/","name":"George A. The living dead have taken over the world, and the last humans live in a walled city to protect themselves as they come to grips with the situation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0418819/","name":"Land of the Dead","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzU1MDI1NDM1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzU5OTkyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The living dead have taken over the world, and the last humans live in a walled city to protect themselves as they come to grips with the situation.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0418819/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"lastliberal","dateCreated":"2007-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Certainly a blood fest","reviewBody":"Simon Baker leads in this film as a mercenary who wants to head up North. Maybe the undead do not like the cold. He find himself trapped between various warring factions, including a ruthless CEO (Dennis Hopper) who offers safety to the wealthy while allowing the unwashed masses to fend for themselves, a fellow mercenary (John Leguizamo) who will sacrifice anyone to advance his own agenda, and hordes of zombies who are starting to take steps up the evolutionary ladder. They actually used a gun in this film. First time I've seen a zombie do more than eat. They even went in the water. Apes don't do that! Lots of blood, but there was less action than I've seen and more talking.\n\nI love John Leguizamo, and that made it worth my time. Seeing Asia Argento (xXx) wasn't bad either.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":94382,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-08-24","keywords":"zombie apocalypse,post apocalypse,zombie film,zombie survival,survival horror","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Land of the Dead","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1419051289","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODZhYWUxMDQtNWMzOC00ZjM2LWI2ZWEtNjliNzU5YjEwYThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODZhYWUxMDQtNWMzOC00ZjM2LWI2ZWEtNjliNzU5YjEwYThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000491/","name":"John Leguizamo","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000782/","name":"Asia Argento","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048932/","name":"Simon Baker"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001681/","name":"George A. programme.title: Mr. Jones
Mr. Jones
programme.desc:
Mr. Jones: Directed by Mike Figgis. With Richard Gere, Lena Olin, Anne Bancroft, Tom Irwin. After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107611/","name":"Mr. Jones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDczYzlhOGUtZGQ1ZS00NTg1LWE4MjEtY2VkNDIzZWQzODZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMjk0MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107611/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"clivy"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Something is happening here, but you don't know what it is, do you, Mr. Jones?","reviewBody":"I don't know very much about bipolar depression, aside from reading biographies of Robert Lowell, the poet. I have to say though that Richard Gere is outstanding in this movie. It started showing on ITV2 and his performance drew me into the story- I had to watch it to the end.

It's a brave premise for a Hollywood film but "Mr. Jones" is let down by a flawed script. I was offended by the way the doctor was portrayed. Of course she was played by a stunning actress, of course she became attached to her patient- to the point of invading his privacy by looking up his friends from his time at music college twenty years earlier. Oh, and of course (SPOILER- in more ways than one) she slept with him as well. She offers to resign which keeps her from being professionally ruined  sorry, but I can't see a qualified and experienced psychiatrist falling in love with her patient, let along sleeping with him while he's still under treatment. The ending peters out as well- to suggest that they will become a couple, I suppose.

The hospital scenes are strong and moving, as is the the subplot about the young student. This could have been an interesting study of people in emotional distress. Too bad they couldn't match Mr. Jones with unsentimental and uncompromising portraits of those trying to help him.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-10-08","keywords":"love,psychiatrist,bipolar disorder,concert,arrest","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000152/","name":"Richard Gere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000565/","name":"Lena Olin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000843/","name":"Anne Bancroft"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001214/","name":"Mike Figgis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066604/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744839/","name":"Eric Roth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0188165/","name":"Michael Cristofer"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

I have to say though that Richard Gere is outstanding in this movie. It started showing on ITV2 and his performance drew me into the story- I had to watch it to the end.

It's a brave premise for a Hollywood film but "Mr. Jones" is let down by a flawed script. I was offended by the way the doctor was portrayed. Oh, and of course (SPOILER- in more ways than one) she slept with him as well. Snakehead Terror
programme.desc:
Snakehead Terror: Directed by Paul Ziller. With Alistair Abell, Doug Abrahams, Carol Alt, Bruce Boxleitner. A small town, desperate to recover from hard economic times, is under threat when voracious Snakehead fish mutate and survive previous lake chemical poisonings." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0371954/","name":"Snakehead Terror","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5ODI2NjI5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjI5ODY3Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A small town, desperate to recover from hard economic times, is under threat when voracious Snakehead fish mutate and survive previous lake chemical poisonings.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0371954/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rstef1"},"dateCreated":"2004-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Terrifyingly Bad","reviewBody":"Yet another mutant killer fish movie. The twist this time is that they can walk on land. Gasp! What could be scarier than an overgrown, flesh eating carp dragging itself through the mud after its intended victim? Just about anything else actually.

Tired format of decent sheriff (conveniently single) teaming with smart (and sexy of course) biologist to defeat the threat, while trying to convince the hard headed mayor to close the lake etc. etc. You've seen it all before, and way better in Jaws, Piranha and so forth.

Lame special effects, poor lighting, bad acting, annoying teens...need I go on? Not an original, frightening or worthwhile moment in the whole mess.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1619,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-03-13","keywords":"creature feature,fish,growth hormone,mounted fish,animal death","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0008533/","name":"Alistair Abell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0009002/","name":"Doug Abrahams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000745/","name":"Carol Alt"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0956484/","name":"Paul Ziller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0169785/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043059/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0338668/","name":"Anthony L. When a group of friends get stranded on a seemingly deserted island, they soon realize that they're not alone." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1277731/","name":"Reptisaurus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzMDcwOTkwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDExOTQ0MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a group of friends get stranded on a seemingly deserted island, they soon realize that they're not alone.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1277731/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"busterggi"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"About your average SyFy Channel movie.","reviewBody":"Well There is a cgi monster which varies in size from shot to shot, it has no motivation for just killing everyone it encounters (not hungry, not scared, not territorial) although the characters are so bland that death is a sweet release for them.\n\nHonestly, I was a huge fan of the original comic (Charleton Comics give you more!) back in the early '60's and the producers using the name is why I watched it. The credits claim this was based on the comic - it wasn't, it was just a misuse of the name.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":183,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.5},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2009-06-10","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001266/","name":"Gil Gerard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1889754/","name":"Bernard Fredericks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2550755/","name":"Michael Galvez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712782/","name":"Christopher Ray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1684558/","name":"Jeremiah Campbell"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dominion
Dominion
programme.desc:
Dominion: Created by Vaun Wilmott. With Christopher Egan, Tom Wisdom, Roxanne McKee, Luke Allen-Gale. Follows the perilous journey of a rebellious young soldier who discovers he's the unlikely savior of humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3079768/","name":"Dominion","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NDcyMzI3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDc3ODc1MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the perilous journey of a rebellious young soldier who discovers he's the unlikely savior of humanity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3079768/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dariana-ro"},"dateCreated":"2014-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I love it","reviewBody":"As far as I can see people love or hate this show. There aren't many moderate opinions in the reviews. I can see why people who are religious may be offended by the idea that angels can turn evil and try to kill people and God would just leave but you should try to relax and not take it so seriously .

I love this show. The actors do a decent job, I like the characters , there are many ways they can develop the plot and the special effects are not so bad (I like the wings).

So God disappeared , no one knows where and why, and Gabriel and many other angels blame humans for it . Gabriel thinks God was very disappointed in humans but didn't had the heart to send another flood or something to kill them so he just left so he does not have to see them anymore . They say that hell is not fire but the pain of not being in the presence of God (or something like that) so probably for the angels in this show who spent all their life in the presence of God to suddenly be alone must be hell. That can make someone go a little crazy.

I am looking forward to the next episodes . I can't wait to see what the Whele family will do next in their quest to control the town, find out more about other towns and the tattoos . I hope we get to see Michael fight a lot in the future .

There is also talking about some black worshipers in town . It looks like some people worship Gabriel now as God and William Whele may be one of them.

If God leaving was a test many angels and humans are failing it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23190,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2014-06-19","keywords":"archangel,soldier,infidelity,foursome,orgy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0250659/","name":"Christopher Egan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936300/","name":"Tom Wisdom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1861467/","name":"Roxanne McKee"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2477757/","name":"Vaun Wilmott"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1866969113","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxMzA0MDkzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ1NDkxNjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxMzA0MDkzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ1NDkxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The second season of Syfy's Dominion premieres on Thursday, July 9th."}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3079768, Title: Dominion, --- Description: Dominion: Created by Vaun Wilmott. With Christopher Egan, Tom Wisdom, Roxanne McKee, Luke Allen-Gale. Follows the perilous journey of a rebellious young soldier who discovers he's the unlikely savior of humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3079768/","name":"Dominion","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NDcyMzI3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDc3ODc1MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the perilous journey of a rebellious young soldier who discovers he's the unlikely savior of humanity.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3079768/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"dariana-ro","dateCreated":"2014-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I love it","reviewBody":"As far as I can see people love or hate this show. There aren't many moderate opinions in the reviews. I can see why people who are religious may be offended by the idea that angels can turn evil and try to kill people and God would just leave but you should try to relax and not take it so seriously .

I love this show. The actors do a decent job, I like the characters , there are many ways they can develop the plot and the special effects are not so bad (I like the wings).

So God disappeared , no one knows where and why, and Gabriel and many other angels blame humans for it . Gabriel thinks God was very disappointed in humans but didn't had the heart to send another flood or something to kill them so he just left so he does not have to see them anymore . They say that hell is not fire but the pain of not being in the presence of God (or something like that) so probably for the angels in this show who spent all their life in the presence of God to suddenly be alone must be hell. That can make someone go a little crazy.

I am looking forward to the next episodes . I can't wait to see what the Whele family will do next in their quest to control the town, find out more about other towns and the tattoos . I hope we get to see Michael fight a lot in the future .

There is also talking about some black worshipers in town . It looks like some people worship Gabriel now as God and William Whele may be one of them.

If God leaving was a test many angels and humans are failing it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23190,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2014-06-19","keywords":"archangel,soldier,infidelity,foursome,orgy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0250659/","name":"Christopher Egan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936300/","name":"Tom Wisdom","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1861467/","name":"Roxanne McKee"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135575/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2477757/","name":"Vaun Wilmott"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1866969113","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxMzA0MDkzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ1NDkxNjE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxMzA0MDkzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ1NDkxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The second season of Syfy's Dominion premieres on Thursday, July 9th."</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dark Horse

Dark Horse
programme.desc: Dark Horse: Directed by Todd Solondz. With Melisa Young, Jordan Gelber, Selma Blair, Mia Farrow. Romance blooms between two tricenarians in arrested development: an avid toy collector who is the dark horse of his family and a depressed woman on the rebound." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1690455/","name":"Dark Horse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjI5MDNjMDgtYjRlNy00ZGEyLWI3OTItZWIxYTcyY2FhNGU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance blooms between two tricenarians in arrested development: an avid toy collector who is the dark horse of his family and a depressed woman on the rebound.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1690455/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"felixx-968-289082"},"dateCreated":"2012-10-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Uncomfortably real.","reviewBody":"I get it Todd. Real life is depressing. Abe is a product of American capitalism. He has rich parents, a bad diet, uses pop-culture catch-phrases and assumes an unearned sense of entitlement. It's pretty clear that there's no "Tommy Boy" redemption coming here, but anyone expecting a black humor comedy in it's place will be left wanting. There is little to root for in any of the characters and despite some great, very dry, performances "Dark Horse" is at heart about realism. Jobs are mundane, people are medicated, have awkward conversations and drive to mega malls. As document of the times, "Dark Horse" may be relevant, those seeking a 2 hr escape from reality will feel worse afterwards. Unless you drive a Hummer.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5913,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-06-29","keywords":"hepatitis b,man wrapped in a towel,collectible,theater poster,poster","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi516268569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance blooms between two thirty-somethings in arrested development: an avid toy collector who lives with his parents and a woman who is the dark horse of her family. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0312217/","name":"Jordan Gelber"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004757/","name":"Selma Blair"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000686/","name":"Christopher Walken"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001754/","name":"Todd Solondz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316179/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001754/","name":"Todd Solondz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0543283/","name":"Harold Manning"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

Mary is a hit woman working for an organized crime family in Boston, whose life is completely turned around when she meets a young boy whose path she crosses when a professional hit goes bad." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6421110/","name":"Proud Mary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MjI3MDU1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjYwMTkxNDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mary is a hit woman working for an organized crime family in Boston, whose life is completely turned around when she meets a young boy whose path she crosses when a professional hit goes bad.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6421110/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tommyt739"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"What a surprise.","reviewBody":"Saw this back to back with The Commuter. I wouldn't go so far as to say Henson outshines Neeson. But it's damn close. Was expecting more from him, less from her. So strange that it turned out the other way around. Both very predictable. You expect that from Mary but not from people on a train. Unfortunately after opening with the best use of song since Denzel drove out of Los Angeles in Roman J. Israel, Esq. it goes flat. No reason not to see it. Not much else out right now. programme.title: Disturbing Behavior
Grzeczny świat
Disturbing Behavior
programme.desc:
Disturbing Behavior: Directed by David Nutter. With James Marsden, Katie Holmes, Tobias Mehler, Nick Stahl. The new kid in Cradle Bay, Washington stumbles across something sinister about the town's method of transforming its unruly teens into upstanding citizens." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0134619/","name":"Disturbing Behavior","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjcxNGQ2MTktZGI0OC00YTA3LWFlMWUtYzA5NDM5Y2E5NzU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The new kid in Cradle Bay, Washington stumbles across something sinister about the town's method of transforming its unruly teens into upstanding citizens.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0134619/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"swayland7"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Easy to Dismiss, but Worth a Look","reviewBody":"Disturbing Behavior is a difficult film for a serious movie critic to defend, primarily because of a long-standing prejudice to both the teen and horror genres. Granted, few teen movies are designed to treat their subjects with any degree of seriousness. And of all the film genres, horror is kept alive with only the slightest bit of effort, accompanied by even slighter expectations. But director David Nutter tackles both these obstacles in a rare attempt to sophisticate Hollywood's offerings to teen audiences and bring dignity to the maligned horror genre. Despite a screenplay written contrary to his vision, Nutter succeeds in creating a dramatic, moody, and entertaining sci-fi/horror yarn far more difficult to dismiss than its contemporary equivalents. That is, until MGM destroyed it.

It's important to note that the version of Disturbing Behavior being analyzed here is the director's cut, which is not the version released in theaters. Nutter's cut isn't available commercially, but if you watch the DVD's considerable amount of deleted footage and the original ending, you can see just how devastating the studio's changes were. 

After suffering the loss of his older brother, Steve and his family relocate to Cradle Bay, where some of the kids at school aren't quite themselves these days. With the help of friends Rachel (Katie Holmes) and Gavin (Nick Stahl), Steve discovers that a local doctor, Caldicott (Bruce Greenwood), is conspiring with parents to lobotomize their teens in order to create "good boys and girls", all of whom become members of the school's Blue Ribbon elitist clique. Caldicott's experiments prevent the Blue Ribbons from sexual impulses and mold them into academic achievers that spend a great deal of their time trying to recruit others to "the program". Unfortunately, the experiments don't always work and trouble is at hand, especially when Steve's parents sign him up.

Scott Rosenberg, the screenwriter of the film, later expressed great disappointment with Nutter's handling of the material. Rosenberg, the screenwriter of Con-Air and Beautiful Girls, never intended his script to be treated as dramatically or realistically as Nutter executed it. Instead, it was supposed to be more "hip" and "cool", allegedly without being mired down by characterization or atmosphere. This seems to indicate that the screenwriter, like the studio executives, had low ambitions with the material, planning to do nothing more than churn out another cheap horror film that insults the intelligence of its target audience. 

David Nutter, a veteran director of The X-Files, saw the potential in Rosenberg's script and acted on it. He started by casting three of the most talented young actors in Hollywood. James Marsden breaks the stereotype that models can't be good actors by delivering a subtle, restrained performance as Steve. Katie Holmes has a few opportunities to demonstrate her abilities as well. As the socially outcast Rachel, Holmes combines a defensive posture with an underlying desire to connect. Nick Stahl has the meatiest part, playing the cynical Gavin, a critic of all the other cliques at school. Gavin's quiet omnipotence is colored by a dry sense of humor much needed in the film. Other notable performances include William Sadler as Newberry, the school's janitor. Newberry is a little off kilter, squinting, grumbling, and hell-bent on ridding the world of all rats. Another interesting character who almost steals the show is U.V. (Chad E. Donella), Gavin's reticent albino friend who spends most of the film sitting at Gavin's side and uttering only a few syllables. 

Nutter's style is very much the signature X-Files style, dark, steamy, creepy, and purposeful. To achieve this, Nutter enlisted an X-Files photographer (John S. Bartley), the X-Files composer (Mark Snow), several X-Files actors (including Steve Railsback, aka Duane Barry), and key production personnel. The result is a movie that feels like an X-Files spin-off, with a subdued ambiance that washes over you and gets under your skin. Nutter commissioned one of the more remarkable opening title sequences in recent film history, one that serves as a cinematic prelude to the lobotomy procedure later in the film - a rapidly-edited montage of happy images and words designed to hypnotize and brainwash Caldicott's victims. 

If Disturbing Behavior should be criticized, it certainly loses points in its third act, one that falls dangerously close to cliché, with Steve becoming more the archetypal hero figure in a predictable and unimaginative showdown with Caldicott and the Blue Ribbons. Since the third act of any story is largely plot (character development is usually pretty well wrapped-up by then), I imagine Nutter had little to work with from Rosenberg's original screenplay. That the first two acts were so emotionally engaging is the result of Nutter's persistence and better judgment. It's too bad that MGM freaked out after a test screening in Texas and thought they could improve their numbers by shortening the film and forcing it into the cookie-cutter shape of the average, low-achieving horror flick. 

I champion this film because of its thematic content and its ideology. Like many of my favorite films (RoboCop, Dances with Wolves, Rebel Without a Cause), it deals with characters in crises of identity, trying to become or remain whole, and connect with each other. Equally interesting to me are the notions of sexual repression as a sign of perfection, man playing God, parents' willingness to medically alter their children, and human unwillingness to face loss. Nutter's bold vision for this material, his ability to cull it from a screenplay where it was not just dormant, but banished, makes his director's cut a remarkable achievement. Add in the exemplary performances of Marsden, Stahl, and Holmes, and that special X-Files flare, and I've got something I can really sink my teeth into. - Scott Schirmer","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21877,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1998-07-24","keywords":"high school,stepford wives plot,grocery store,fellatio,teenage","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Disturbing Behavior","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1102757657","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWEyNDIzYTktNzRhYi00NGZkLWEwZDMtM2RkN2UwMDUyNmM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWEyNDIzYTktNzRhYi00NGZkLWEwZDMtM2RkN2UwMDUyNmM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005188/","name":"James Marsden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005017/","name":"Katie Holmes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001763/","name":"Nick Stahl"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0638354/","name":"David Nutter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050640/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064908/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003298/","name":"Scott Rosenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="
